title: Information contained in a WebIDL file
summary: When writing documentation about an API, the sources of information are many: the specifications describe what should be implemented as well as the model, and the implementations describe what has actually been put in the browsers. WebIDL files are a very condensed way of giving a lot, but not all, of the information about the API. This document provides a reference to help understand WebIDL syntax.
short_title: Information contained in a WebIDL file
